note.p: Birth: Cape of Good Hope, Cape Colony [now in South Africa], Africa (04 April 1808)
Death: Newstead House, Launceston, Tasmania, Australia, Oceania (14 March 1881)
Research area: Natural history; botany; zoology

Career: Royal Engineers at Barbados; Superintendent of convicts for North Tasmania at Launceston (1830); police magistrate at Circular Head (1836); assistant police magistrate at Hobart Town (1838); private secretary to the Lieutenant-Governor of Tasmania Sir John Franklin and clerk of the executive and legislative councils (1839); estate manager to William Effingham Lawrence (1841); travelled widely in Tasmania and made zoological collections for the British Museum; corresponded with botanists Sir William Jackson Hooker FRS, Sir Joseph Dalton Hooker PRS and John Lindley FRS and collected botanical specimens for them in Tasmania
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; AuDB; Wikipedia
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1882-1883 vol 34 pp xiii-xv signed by J D H
Notes: RS sources give his first name as Ronald, but DNB and Boase give Robert, AuDB gives first name as Ronald.
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
